title: Royal Mail Has Trouble Delivering Letters
summary: Royal Mail is a company that delivers mail in the UK. Some postal workers say they are very busy and cannot deliver all the letters on time. They often focus on delivering parcels first because parcels make more money for the company. This means letters can sit in depots for weeks without being delivered. People are upset because they miss important things like hospital appointments or school certificates when letters arrive late. Royal Mail says most mail is delivered as planned, but many workers and customers disagree. The workers feel stretched and say there are not enough vans to do all the work. This problem affects many people across the UK.

background_read: Royal Mail is a big mail delivery company in the UK that sends letters and parcels to homes. Postal workers are the employees who sort and deliver the mail. Sometimes, when there is too much work, things can get delayed. This article talks about how some workers and customers are unhappy because letters are not arriving on time, which can cause problems like missing doctor visits or important documents.
Article_Structure: WHO: Royal Mail postal workers and customers
WHAT: Letters are delayed because parcels are prioritized
WHERE: In the UK, at Royal Mail depots and delivery offices
WHY: Workers are too busy and focus on parcels for money, leading to missed appointments and frustration

perspectives.description: They say they are overworked and have to prioritize parcels over letters, causing delays.
They are frustrated because late letters make them miss important events like hospital appointments.
They claim most mail is delivered on time and understand customer frustration.
